DataElement.preferredName: DART Currently Have Shortness of Breath Score 11 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of their current shortness of breath, using an 11 point visual analogue scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Distress Assessment and Response Tool Current Have Shortness of Breath Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A short, self-assessment to measure an individual's physical symptoms, emotional burden and practical concerns that could interfere with their ability to engage in cancer treatment._Occurring in or belonging to the present time._A question about whether an individual has or had shortness of breath._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A short, self-assessment to measure an individual's physical symptoms, emotional burden and practical concerns that could interfere with their ability to engage in cancer treatment.

Concepts.definition: A short, self-assessment to measure an individual's physical symptoms, emotional burden and practical concerns that could interfere with their ability to engage in cancer treatment.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.:A question about whether an individual has or had shortness of breath.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.
A question about whether an individual has or had shortness of breath.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElementConcept.origin: DART:Distress Assessment and Response Tool, Form D-5668. University Health Network DART Team, Toronto, Canada, 3/2013.

ValueDomain.preferredName: DART Shortness of Breath 11 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A short, self-assessment to measure an individual's physical symptoms, emotional burden and practical concerns that could interfere with their ability to engage in cancer treatment._A shortness of breath scale from 0 to 10 on which the patient marks the current level of shortness of breath experienced._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
